articles.title: National Meeting Marks 50th Anniversary of Repatriation
articles.content:
National Meeting Marks 50th Anniversary of Repatriation
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A national meeting was held at the Central Youth Hall on Tuesday to mark the 50th anniversary of the repatriation of Koreans from Japan.
					 Present at the meeting were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the Cabinet, the chairpersons of the friendly parties, leading officials of working people's organizations, officials concerned, returnees to the socialist homeland from Japan and working people in Pyongyang, the group of Koreans in Japan for expressing thanks on the occasion, delegations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and other Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop in his report said that it was a historical event which brought about a radical turn in the destiny of overseas compatriots and the history of the Juche-oriented overseas compatriots' movement that the first repatriation ship carrying Koreans from Japan dropped its anchor at Chongjin Port on December 16, Juche 48 (1959).
					
					The repatriation of Koreans from Japan was a precious fruition of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il's idea of the Juche-oriented overseas compatriots' movement and their wise leadership he noted, and went on:
					
					 The President put forward the outstanding idea and theory on the overseas compatriots' movement long ago and successfully materialized them, opening a glorious history of the above-said movement.
					
					 True to the President's idea and cause, Kim Jong Il wisely led the struggle for the repatriation of Koreans from Japan.
					
					 When the repatriation operation came to a temporary halt due to the despicable anti-DPRK moves of the Japanese reactionaries and the south Korean puppets, Kim Jong Il took this to heart more than anyone else and clearly indicated a specific orientation and ways for resuming the repatriation.
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il took care of the returnees to the socialist homeland from Japan as their real fathers would do and enabled all of them to lead a worthwhile and happy life as masters of the state and society.
					
					 By pursuing the benevolent politics, all-embracing politics based on love and trust Kim Jong Il provided not only Korean returnees from Japan but also Japanese spouses who came to the DPRK together with their husbands with the same conditions for a worthwhile socio-political life and let them work at important posts of the revolution so that they might fully enjoy a dignified life free from any national discrimination.
					
					 The dignity and might of Songun Korea have reached the highest level and the future of the country and the movement of Koreans in Japan is very bright, the reporter noted, calling upon all the people to single-mindedly unite around Kim Jong Il and wage a more dynamic struggle to build a thriving nation, achieve the independent reunification of the country, develop the movement of Koreans in Japan and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Condolence Telegram to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Condolence Telegram to Syrian President
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday sent a message of condolences to Bashar Al Assad, President of Syria, as regards the death of his younger brother Majud Hafez Al Assad from a long illness.
					In the message Kim expressed deep condolences to the Syrian President and the bereaved family, hoping that they would overcome the sadness.

articles.title: Ro Tu Chol Meets US Businessmen Delegation
articles.content:
Ro Tu Chol Meets US Businessmen Delegation
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of U.S. businessmen headed by General Charles Boyd, president and CEO of the Business Executives for National Security (BENS),  at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.

articles.title: Ministry of People's Security Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
Ministry of People's Security Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of People's Security led by Minister Ju Sang Song left here today by air to visit China.

articles.title: US-DPRK Science Engagement Consortium Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
US-DPRK Science Engagement Consortium Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the U.S.-DPRK science engagement consortium led by Peter Agre, president of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, left here for home by air on Tuesday after discussing the matter of cooperation and exchange in the field of scientific research.

articles.title: Gift from Austrian Figure
articles.content:
Gift  from Austrian Figure
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Oliver Jonischkeit, federal secretary of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by the federal secretary on Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful at East Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful at East Asian Games
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Players of the DPRK proved successful at the Fifth East Asian Games.
					 Kim Kum Ok, winner of a gold medal at the 11th Asian Marathon Championship last year, and Kim Kyong Jin placed first respectively in the half marathon race and the men's 60 kg category judo event held on Dec. 13.
					
					 Meanwhile Pak Song Il, Ri Chol Ryong, Rim Yun Hui and Pak Ok Song captured silver medals in the men's 90kg and 66kg category judo events and the women's 57kg and 48kg category judo events, Paek Un Hui in the women's 53kg category weightlifting event, Pak Song Chol in the men's half marathon race and Choe Kum Hui and Kim Un Hyang in the women's 10m-platform duet synchronized diving respectively.
					
					 Jo Yong Suk, O Jong Ae, Ryang Chun Hwa, Cha Kum Chol, Pang Kum Chol, Kim Jin Ok, Hyon Jong Hui, Won Ok Im and Kim Chol Su each came third in the women's 10m-air pistol shooting event, the women's 58kg and 48kg category weightlifting events, the men's 62kg and 77kg category weightlifting events, the women's 10m-platform diving, the women's 70kg and 63kg category judo events and the men's 73kg category judo event.

articles.title: New Natural Products Designated
articles.content:
New Natural Products Designated
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- New items have been added to the list of the country's natural products by recent decisions of the Cabinet of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					Thanks to the intensified survey by officials and workers in the sector of cultural preservation, several dozen things of historical and scientific value have been designated as natural monuments this year.
					
					Typical of them is Pyolgumgang, a scenic spot in Kosong County, Kangwon Province. When visiting Mt. Kumgang in August Juche 62 (1973), General Secretary Kim Jong Il said the spot should be converted into a tourist resort and a rest place for holiday-makers.
					
					With a 100-meter-round pond on its 320-meter-high peak surrounded by 20-meter-high fascinating cliffs, Pyolgumgang presents a wonderful natural scenery.
					
					Included in the list are Rakchon Cavern in Kowon County, South Hamgyong Province and Obong Cavern in Sunchon City, South Phyongan Province. The limestone caverns came into being in the latter half of the Paleozoic era and the fourth glacial age respectively.
					
					In Samjiyon area scores of 400-odd-year-old larch trees have been registered as natural products. 
					
					On an average the trees are more than 30 meters high, 80 centimeters across and 250 centimeters round in lower part. 
					
					Among the newly registered natural monuments are 700-odd-year-old gingko tree in Jaha-ri, Sinwon County, South Hwanghae Province, 270-odd-year-old chestnut tree, a good fruiter, in Kwanhak Valley in Samsok District, Pyongyang, and Chamaecyparis pisifera and Pinus strobus in Songhung-dong, Wonsan City, Kangwon Province.
					
					Thaethan razor clam of South Hwanghae Province, well known to the world for its peculiar taste, and Samjiyon goldfish of significance in ecological study of fishes living in highland are also included in the list.

articles.title: Multi-purpose Solar Greenhouse Built
articles.content:
Multi-purpose Solar Greenhouse Built
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Natural Energy Development and Utilization Center of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has built a multi-purpose solar greenhouse with great economic effectiveness.
					 The mud-walled greenhouse consists of a vegetable cultivation block, domestic animal pens, a methane tank and fishpond. With the processes of production (vegetable), consumption (fodder) and dissolution (fermentation) combined in a rational way, it gives no pollution to environment. 
					
					 The by-products from the vegetable cultivation are taken to feed pigs and excrement of pigs to produce methane. And liquid manure coming from the fermentation is used as fodder of fish and additional manure, while gas is utilized in preparing fodder and adjusting the temperature of the greenhouse.
					
					 The greenhouse has the angle of inclination and pitch of roofs designed to make a maximum use of solar heat and offer convenience in management. An insulation layer was installed in the back wall to prevent the formation of air current and minimize heat loss.
					
					 A channel-shaped fishpond was made in the front part of the greenhouse to store heat in the daytime and let out heat in the evening, making it possible to prevent cool air coming from the outside and keep the temperature of the greenhouse above ten degrees C in winter without using fuel like coal.
					
					 It is also possible to readjust the blocks of vegetable cultivation, fish breeding and animal pens.

articles.title: 50th Anniversary of Repatriation Marked
articles.content:
50th Anniversary of Repatriation Marked
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Five decades have passed since the first ship carrying Korean repatriates from Japan dropped its anchor at a port of the homeland on Dec. 16, Juche 48 (1959).
					 Their repatriation to their much longed-for homeland marked a great turning point in their lives. 
					
					Under the loving care of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il many of them became deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly and to power organs of various other levels, recipients of Order of Kim Il Sung, Kim Il Sung Prize winners, labor heroes and heroines, recipients of state citations and academic degrees and titles, honorary titles and emerged officials of party, administrative and economic institutions.
					
					 Labor hero, Academician, Prof. and Dr. Ri Ryong Am, researcher at the Institute of Coal Mining Engineering of the Coal Mining Science Branch under the State Academy of Sciences, is one of those who were given new flats after being repatriated to the homeland by the first ship in December Juche 48 (1959). He grew up to be such renowned scientist under the particular care of the President and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Had Kim Pyong Hwa remained in Japan he could not have realized his hope and brought his talent into bloom. 
					
					 The President and Kim Jong Il brought him up to be chief of the creating staff and chief conductor of the prestigious State Symphony Orchestra in the socialist homeland and enabled him to glorify his life as a Kim Il Sung Prize winner, deputy to the SPA and People's Artiste.
					
					 The same can be said of Jo Chong Mi who was born in Japan and repatriated to the homeland. As an actress of the Phibada Opera Troupe she played a main role in the revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood," emerging People's Actress loved by the people and winner of an international concours.  
					
					 Prof. and Dr. Ri Tong Gyu is researcher at the Sports Science Institute under the Academy of Sports Science, well known to the Korean people as a famous "TV soccer commentator". Now he is over 70 but is still contributing full of energy to the nation's soccer development.
					
					 The President was very pleased to hear the news that a baby was born aboard the second repatriation ship and personally named him Kim Kuigukdong. He grew up under the blessings of the President to be secretary of the Primary Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea of the Food Administration Centre of Hoesang District, Hamhung City.  He is now working hard to repay the profound loving care shown by the President. 
					
					 Ryu Sun Ryol, rector of the Information Science and Technology College of Kim Chaek University of Technology, has greatly contributed to the education of the rising generation and the development of the nation's information science and technology under the loving care of the great teacher. He and Kim Se Chal, chief engineer of the Ryuwon Shoes Factory, and many other returnees from Japan are now devoting their wisdom and energy to achieving the prosperity of the country to live up to the Party's profound trust with great results. 
					
					 The returnees from Japan are looking back with deep emotion on the years during which they have led a worthwhile life under the Korean-style socialist system centering on the popular masses, while observing the above-said anniversary in the significant period when a landmark phase is being brought about in the drive for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Western Countries' Wrong Attitude towards US Blasted
articles.content:
Western Countries' Wrong Attitude towards US Blasted
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Western forces are improperly behaving toward the U.S. which is ridiculous enough to admonish this or that country, uttering its "human rights performance is a matter of concern" and it should strive to "improve its human rights record" whenever an opportunity presents itself. This wrong attitude comes under fire by a signed commentary of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 They are joining the U.S. in its human rights racket, keeping mum about its hideous human rights abuses.
					
					 Western countries have served the U.S. as their "elder brother" in the past but have not been properly treated by it. The U.S. ignored their will when deciding to launch military invasion of Iraq under the pretext of "eliminating WMDs" in disregard of the United Nations.
					
					 Under that situation the Western countries should have taken a proper approach towards Washington, well aware of its arrogant and self-opinionated mode of thinking which prompts it to engross itself in attaining its selfish goal in disregard of others' interests.
					
					 They are so mean as to seek their ulterior political aim under the pretext of the "human rights issue". They are calling into question "human rights records" of those countries strong in their independent stand, those countries which refuse to accept the Western-style view on value, political mode, while toeing the U.S. line.
					
					 They seek to internationally isolate these countries and put them under their control while kicking up campaigns for pressure and sanctions over their "human rights issues." The evermore noisier rackets kicked up by the U.S. and other Western countries over the non-existent "human rights issues" of other countries will only bring into bolder relief their sinister intention. 
					
					 They would be well advised to mind their own business before imprudently talking about someone's "human rights issue".

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Standing in Way of Improving Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Standing in Way of Improving Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- It is necessary to immediately eliminate from the arena of history the south Korean confrontation maniacs, bete noire of the Koreans, the root cause of calamities and cancer-like existence in the way of national reunification, in order to achieve the national reconciliation, unity and reunification, their cherished desire. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday urges this in a signed article.
					 Recalling that the DPRK has made every sincere effort as evidenced by a series of important measures taken by it to put the abnormal relations between the north and the south on a right track and promote the national reconciliation and unity, the article says:
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities' attitude and stand remain unchanged and they got more insolent and provocative than ever before.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities including Hyon In Thaek, minister of "Unification", disregarded without hesitation an opportunity of improving the inter-Korean relations and escalated the anti-DPRK confrontation racket in a bid to achieve their sinister aims.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have opted to escalate the north-south confrontation, persistently denying dialogue and cooperation indispensable for improving the relations.
					
					 This proves that the south Korean ruling forces do not have even the slightest will to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve the national reunification through dialogue and cooperation with the north.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are becoming ever more frantic in their anti-DPRK human rights campaign, invariably seeking the confrontation of systems and a sinister aim to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The madcap anti-DPRK racket kicked up by the conservative ruling forces of south Korea over the non-existent "human rights issue" is an intolerable politically motivated provocation against the DPRK as it is a revelation of the sinister intention to tarnish the image of the dignified socialist system in the DPRK and bring the confrontation of systems to an extreme phase. This, at the same time, betrays their criminal wicked scenario to escalate the confrontation with compatriots over the "human rights issue" and bring the inter-Korean relations to an uncontrollable catastrophe.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have desperately perpetrated reckless military provocations and moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK, leveling guns at the fellow countrymen desirous of dialogue and improved relations.
					
					 The puppets' reckless confrontation offensive against the DPRK has vitiated the atmosphere of the process to improve the inter-Korean relations and again pushed the situation to an uncontrollable catastrophe.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group including Hyon In Thaek are bound to face a severe judgment by history and the nation as they persistently seek a way out in the confrontation with the DPRK, swimming against the requirement of the times and the desire of the compatriots.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Crime-woven Past
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Its Crime-woven Past
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Japan should settle its inglorious past and make due reparation for it in keeping with the demand and trend of the times, mindful that its future depends on the settlement of its past. Minju Joson Tuesday urges this in a signed commentary.
					 It cites facts that those countries which committed war crimes or imposed damage on others in the past have taken honest actions to settle their past wrongs. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 However, the attitude of Japan, a war criminal state, is quite different from theirs in the light of the present trend of the international community toward the settlement of past.
					
					 As well known to the world, Japan inflicted enormous misfortune and pain on humankind during the Second World War as was the case with Germany and Italy. Japan is a criminal state as it had occupied Korea for more than 40 years, imposing untold human, material and moral losses on the Korean people.
					
					 Nevertheless, the reactionaries of Japan have refused even to admit its past crimes, far from making apology for them. On the contrary they are persistently trying to keep their past crime-woven history buried into oblivion.
					
					 Japan is not allowed to behave as it pleases as far as the settlement of its past is concerned. It is a moral obligation and a duty under international law for Japan to settle its past.
					
					 Japan's any further delay in settling its past would only add to its crimes and invite more thorough international isolation and bitterer worldwide criticism.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Apology for Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Apology for Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The International Solidarity Council Demanding Settlement of Japan's Past released an appeal to the governments, parliaments, organizations and peoples of different countries on December 8, 68 years since Japan started the Pacific War.
					 Aged victims are still conducting a campaign urging the Japanese government to make a sincere apology and proper reparation for Japan's past crimes in different parts of the world, but Japan is making sinister efforts to justify the history of aggression and crimes, inviting rebuff and ridicule of the international community, the appeal noted, and continued:
					
					 2010 will mark the lapse of 65 years since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists and the centenary of the fabrication of the illegal "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty". Japan should make an apology to the victims for its past war crimes and the human rights abuses, stop distorting its history and formally pay reparation to the countries and people that fell victim to them and the bereaved families as early as possible as urged by the international community.
					
					 Noting that the said council would boost the world-wide solidarity in the struggle to have the above-said demands met in the future, too, the appeal called upon the governments, parliaments, organizations and peoples of different countries to extend positive support and encouragement to it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia telegrama de condolencias a Bashar Al-Assad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia telegrama de condolencias a Bashar Al-Assad
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 14 un telegrama de condolencias a Bashar Al-Assad, secretario regional del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe y presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					El telegrama senala:
					
					Al enterarme de la noticia triste de que su hermano menor, Majud Hafez Al-Assad, fallecio a causa de la enfermedad incurable, expreso mis sinceras condolencias a usted y a los familiares del difunto.

articles.title: Acto central por 50o aniversario de repatriacion de coreanos en Japon
articles.content:
Acto central por 50o aniversario de repatriacion de coreanos en Japon
 Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el acto central por el 50o aniversario de la repatriacion del primer grupo de los coreanos que residian en Japon.
					  En la ocasion participaron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jung Rin, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, Kwak Pom Gi, los presidentes de partidos amigos, los funcionarios directivos de las organizaciones de masas y otros funcionarios, los ciudadanos mudados a la patria socialista, los trabajadores capitalinos, el grupo de agradecimiento de coreanos residentes en Japon, la delegacion de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon y los compatriotas residentes en este pais isleno.
					
					  El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Yang Hyong Sop quien recordo que hace ahora 50 anos, exactamente, el 16 de diciembre del 48 (1959) de la Era Juche llego al puerto de Chongjin el primer barco en que regresaban a su patria socialista (RPDC)  los coreanos que residian en Japon.
					
					Este acontecimiento historico trajo el cambio radical en el destino de los coreanos en ultramar y en la historia del autoctono movimiento de ellos, subrayo el informante y continuo:
					
					  La repatriacion de los coreanos en Japon fue el fruto precioso de la idea del autoctono movimiento de los coreanos en ultramar y la sabia direccion sobre el mismo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					  El Presidente presento hace mucho tiempo su destacada idea y teoria sobre el movimiento en cuestion y al materializarlas, dio inicio a la gloriosa historia del mismo.
					
					  En pleno acato a la idea y la causa del Presidente, el Dirigente organizo y dirigio sabiamente al frente la lucha por lograr la repatriacion de los coreanos radicados en Japon.
					
					  Cuando fue suspendida temporalmente esta labor debido a la brutal campana anti-RPDC de los reaccionarios japoneses y los titeres surcoreanos, el se puso mas adolorido que nadie e indico con toda claridad y en detalles el rumbo y los remedios para reanudarla.
					
					  El Presidente y el Dirigente les aseguraron con afecto paternal a todos los repatriados una valiosa y feliz vida digna de los duenos del Estado y la sociedad.
					
					  Ademas, partiendo de su politica de beneficios populares y la abarcadora, basadas en el amor y la confianza, el Dirigente facilito tambien a las mujeres japonesas, que se mudaron a Corea siguiendo a sus esposos coreanos, las muy valiosas condiciones socio-politicas, que fueron concedidas a los repatriados, y les ubico en los importantes puestos revolucionarios.
					
					  De esta manera, garantizo que ellas vivieran dignamente sin sufrir ninguna clase de discriminacion nacional
					
					  Hoy dia, llegaron al maximo plano la dignidad y la potencia de la Corea del Songun y es maravilloso y prometedor el futuro de nuestra patria y el movimiento de los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					  Todos los coreanos, unidos en torno al Dirigente con la misma voluntad y proposito, deben luchar con mas vigor por edificar una gran potencia prospera, reunificar la patria de manera independiente, consolidar el movimiento de los coreanos residentes en Japon y llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche.

articles.title: Vicepremier coreano se reune con delegacion de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Vicepremier coreano se reune con delegacion de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ro Tu Chol departio el dia 15 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo con la delegacion de los empresarios norteamericanos presidida por Charles Boyd, presidente y CEO (Oficial Ejecutivo en Jefe) de "BENS" (Ejecutores de Negocios por la Seguridad Nacional).

articles.title: Parte de regreso delegacion norteamericana
articles.content:
Parte de regreso delegacion norteamericana
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Regreso el dia 15 por via aerea la delegacion del consorcio encargado de la ciencia Estados Unidos-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por Peter Agre, presidente de la Asociacion Norteamericana para el Avance de la Ciencia, luego de discutir el problema de cooperacion e intercambio en el sector de investigacion cientifica.

articles.title: Japon debe indemnizar crimenes del pasado, subraya Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japon debe indemnizar crimenes del pasado, subraya Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Japon debe tener presente que su futuro depende de la liquidacion del pasado criminal, liquidar deshonroso pasado conforme a la demanda y la corriente de la epoca e indemnizar merecidamente por el respecto.
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continua:
					
					Algunos paises, que perpetraron el crimen de guerra en el pasado o danaron a otros, muestran el movimiento sincero para liquidar su pasado erroneo.
					
					Pero, es tan diferente la actitud de Japon, pais criminal de guerra a la luz de la corriente actual de la sociedad internacional a la liquidacion del pasado criminal.
					
					Como se dieron a conocer a todo el mundo, Japon impuso la gran desgracia y penalidad a la humanidad durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial como Alemania e Italia. En particular, este pais isleno es un Estado criminal que dio innumerables perdidas humanas, materiales y morales al pueblo coreano ocupando a Corea durante mas de 40 anos.
					
					Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses no  reconocen sus crimenes del pasado lejos de pedir disculpa por el respecto sino actuan perversamente para ocultar su historia criminal del pasado.
					
					La liquidacion del pasado no solo es el problema que Japon debe hacer sino tambien es el deber juridico internacional y el moral asumidos a este pais isleno.
					
					Cuanto mas demora tal liquidacion del pasado, tanto mas se aumentaran sus crimenes, aislamiento y rechazo por parte de la sociedad internacional.
